meanings.definition: To move or spread out in a scattered fashion.
meanings.sent1: The children straggled across the playground after recess.
meanings.sent2: The hikers straggled along the winding trail, enjoying the scenery.
meanings.sent3: The colorful balloons straggled behind the parade, trying to catch up.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts straggled like lost sheep, wandering aimlessly.
meanings.sent5: The fallen leaves straggled across the yard, creating a beautiful mess.

meanings.definition: To trail behind or wander away from a group.
meanings.sent1: The tired puppy straggled behind the rest of the litter during the walk.
meanings.sent2: The curious child straggled away from the tour group to explore a hidden path.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel straggled off the tree branch, looking for a new adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her attention straggled from the lecture, lost in daydreams.
meanings.sent5: The old car straggled behind in the race, struggling to keep up with the others.

meanings.definition: To grow or hang loosely and untidily.
meanings.sent1: The vines straggled along the fence, creating a wild look in the garden.
meanings.sent2: Her hair straggled down her back in messy waves after a long day.
meanings.sent3: The old curtains straggled at the edges, in need of some repair.
meanings.sent4: The branches straggled outwards, reaching for the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The ivy straggled up the wall, adding a touch of nature to the building.
